headline: General Motors Company (GM) CEO and Chair Mary Barra Sells Shares; UBS Upgrades GM to Buy, Raises PT to $81
summary: General Motors Company (NYSE:GM) secures a spot on our list of the 20 NYSE Stocks with the Lowest P/E Ratios. headline: EV sales to 'hit a speed bump,' but not fall off post-tax credit
summary: Electric vehicle (EVs) sales jumped ahead of the expiration of the EV tax credit. Cox Automotive executive analyst Erin Keating shares her expectations for the wider EV market and specific automakers like Ford (F), General Motors (GM), and Tesla (TSLA). Also catch Yahoo Finance executive editor Brian Sozzi full interview with Ford CEO Jim Farley from the Ford Pro Accelerate forum. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime.

headline: Ford & GM see surge in Q3 car sales: What to know
summary: Ford's (F) sales spiked in the third quarter, including a record for its electric vehicle (EV) sales. General Motors (GM) also saw a sales surge this quarter, selling 710,000 total cars in the US. Yahoo Finance Senior Autos Reporter Pras Subramanian joins Market Domination host Josh Lipton to discuss the details. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

headline: Sovos' Christiaan van der Valk Named Chairman of GENA, Leading Global E-Invoicing Standards and Collaboration
summary: ATLANTA, October 01, 2025--Sovos, the always-on tax compliance company, today announced that GENA, an international trade association for a large and dynamic community of e-invoicing service providers, has elected Christiaan van der Valk, GM, Indirect TaxTech, Sovos, as its new Chairman. GENA works to support business efficiency and innovation, while also supporting top public agenda goals, such as tax efficiency, environmental efficiency and social responsibility.

GENA works to support business efficiency and innovation, while also supporting top public agenda goals, such as tax efficiency, environmental efficiency and social responsibility.

headline: US takes a minority stake company operating one of world's largest lithium mines in Nevada
summary: The U.S. government is taking a minority stake in Lithium Americas, a company that is developing one of the world’s largest lithium mines in northern Nevada.  The Department of Energy will take a 5% equity stake in the miner, which is based in Vancouver.  It will also take a 5% stake in the Thacker Pass lithium mining project, a joint venture with General Motors.
